text.p: Headlines from major national newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
EL PAIS
- Seven dead in first armed clash between Palestinian police and Israeli army
- PP representatives criticise key aspects of government policy
- RTVE foresees more expenditure, record deficit and loss of leadership
- Aznar disavows Serra comments on military shooting range
EL MUNDO
- Gonzalez asks Justice department to respect decisions of Aznar's government
- Aznar disavows Serra - there won't be a shooting range at Anchuras
- CiU pulls out another 70 billion pesetas from government for health
- Shooting battle between Israeli army and Arafat's police
LA VANGUARDIA
- First clash between Israeli army and Palestinian police
- Aznar reaffirms Cesid papers won't be declassified
- Pujol affirms that Spanish isn't a foreign language but the mother tongue of many Catalans
DIARIO 16
- Aznar disavows Serra and opts to defend Anchuras
- Death in Palestine because of Salomon Tunnel
- Government gains support of CiU and CC for budget
ABC
- Liano asks for 350,000 pesetas in pay for delinquent who accuses Civil Guard
CINCO DIAS
- Tax Ministry takes advantage - plans to charge 9.5 percent for payment delays although Mibor and bills yield around seven percent
- Brussels imposes "substantial" disinvestments on Credit Lyonnais
- Pensions - more cost to companies
EXPANSION
- International Monetary Fund sees world economy "strong and healthy" to face the future
- PP closes budget accord with CiU
- Huarte will cut its capital to zero before raising it by four billion
GACETA DE LOS NEGOCIOS
- GDP grows just 1.9 percent despite improvement in consumption and exports
- Ebro-Azucarera will be the fourth Europpean group in the sector
- European Commission demands closures at Astilleros
